intro: Rosa dumalis subvar. subbiserrata, commonly known as the serrated alpine rose, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, arching stems and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are compound, with serrated edges that give the plant its subspecies name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in cooler climates.
